#Text=Mr.
#Text=Reynders (Belgium) (spoke in French): Let\r
#Text=me begin by thanking the Secretary-General for the\r
#Text=report on conflict-related sexual violence (S/2012/33).
#Text=I also wish to thank Ms.
#Text=Margot Wallstrom, Special\r
#Text=Representative of the Secretary-General on Sexual\r
#Text=Violence in Conflict, and her team of experts.
#Text=It is\r
#Text=impossible to remain indifferent in reading the report,\r
#Text=for sexual violence in many societies is still a common\r
#Text=practice, often invisible and too rarely prosecuted.
#Text=Belgium has always been a strong defender of\r
#Text=resolution 1325 (2000) on women, peace and security.
#Text=It formally promises to remain so.
#Text=Belgium associates itself with the statement to be\r
#Text=made on behalf of the European Union.
#Text=I would like to address three subjects.
#Text=First is the mandate of the Special\r
#Text=Representative, which for Belgium is very clear.
#Text=It\r
#Text=allows the Security Council to focus on sexual violence\r
#Text=not only in classic conflict situations but also in\r
#Text=post-conflict situations or other serious situations, such\r
#Text=as political unrest.
#Text=The Council already regularly takes\r
#Text=up such issues in various types of situations.
#Text=I welcome\r
#Text=the reference in the report to instances of sexual\r
#Text=violence in situations of unrest and instability,\r
#Text=particularly in Egypt and Syria.
#Text=To reduce the mandate\r
#Text=\r
#Text=solely to cases of sexual violence in conflict situations\r
#Text=would be tantamount to restricting the role of the\r
#Text=United Nations in defending individuals and societies\r
#Text=that suffer from this terrible scourge.
#Text=We cannot retreat\r
#Text=from the detailed mandate set out in resolution 1960\r
#Text=Furthermore, while sexual Violence mainly\r
#Text=affects women and girls, the Secretary-General's report\r
#Text=makes very clear that the situation of men, especially\r
#Text=those in custody, as well as children born as a result of\r
#Text=rape, deserves greater attention from us.
#Text=Rather than\r
#Text=seeking to lock the mandate into too limited an area of\r
#Text=action, we should develop a comprehensive approach\r
#Text=to protecting civilians.
#Text=My second comment concerns some particular\r
#Text=recommendations in the report, first, that concerning\r
#Text=initiatives and modalities relating to security sector\r
#Text=reform, It is indeed our duty to ensure that those who\r
#Text=perpetrate, command or condone sexual violence are\r
#Text=excluded from all branches of government, including\r
#Text=the armed forces and police.
#Text=In addition, United\r
#Text=Nations mediators and officials also must ensure that\r
#Text=sexual violence is included in the definition of conduct\r
#Text=prohibited by ceasefire and peace agreements.
#Text=Indeed,\r
#Text=Belgium calls particularly for an increase in the\r
#Text=number of women serving as mediators and special\r
#Text=envoys.
#Text=Finally, the third recommendation that I wish to\r
#Text=underline concerns prevention, which is often more\r
#Text=effective than reparation.
#Text=That is why Belgium\r
#Text=supports any initiative aimed at adopting early warning\r
#Text=systems that could detect risks of imminent sexual\r
#Text=violence in regions affected by conflict.
#Text=My third and final comment relates to situations\r
#Text=in some particular countries.
#Text=The Special\r
#Text=Representative has visited the Democratic Republic of\r
#Text=the Congo several times to discuss with top\r
#Text=Government officials the issue of sexual violence,\r
#Text=often committed by military personnel.
#Text=Belgium was\r
#Text=among the first to provide financial support for the\r
#Text=Democratic Republic of the Congo's national strategy\r
#Text=to combat sexual violence.
#Text=We also provided financial\r
#Text=support to the United Nations Organization\r
#Text=Stabilization Mission in the Democratic Republic of\r
#Text=the Congo for military judges to assist with the\r
#Text=\r
#Text=\r
#Text=prosecution of soldiers accused of sexual violence in\r
#Text=the eastern part of the country.
#Text=Belgium intends to\r
#Text=remain engaged in this project, in consultation with the\r
#Text=Special Representative and with national authorities.
#Text=As Chair of the Peacebuilding Commission's\r
#Text=Central African Republic configuration, Belgium\r
#Text=attributes particular importance to the issue of sexual\r
#Text=Violence in that country.
#Text=The Central African Republic\r
#Text=is on the priority list for action by the Special\r
#Text=Representative.
#Text=The problem of Violence against\r
#Text=women and children is discussed during each\r
#Text=Commission field visit, and regular contact on the\r
#Text=subject is maintained with the Office of the Special\r
#Text=Representative.
#Text=The reports on the situations in Libya, Egypt and\r
#Text=Syria are particularly relevant in the context of the\r
#Text=so-called Arab Spring.
#Text=The issue of sexual violence in\r
#Text=countries in transition should not be ignored.
#Text=I am\r
#Text=deeply concerned at reports by the United Nations\r
#Text=commission of inquiry to the effect that Syrian armed\r
#Text=forces and security personnel have used sexual torture\r
#Text=against detainees in various detention centers of the\r
#Text=intelligence and political security services.
#Text=I trust we\r
#Text=shall have an opportunity to speak of that tomorrow, in\r
#Text=the framework of the meeting of the friends of Syria in\r
#Text=Tunis.
#Text=In conclusion, I would like to stress the collective\r
#Text=responsibility for the fight against sexual violence.
#Text=The\r
#Text=Security Council must act on this report, in particular\r
#Text=by transmitting to the sanctions committees the list of\r
#Text=parties responsible for sexual violence, which is\r
#Text=annexed to the report, for effective follow-up.
#Text=The\r
#Text=development of that list is a first, for which I\r
#Text=congratulate the Secretary-General.
#Text=I sincerely trust that the team of the Special\r
#Text=Representative will continue their excellent work.
#Text=I\r
#Text=believe their report is one stage and that there will be\r
#Text=more.
